intro: Kemulariella albovii, commonly known as the white-flowered kemulariella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, giving it a delicate appearance. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
